intro: Pilosella euchaetia subsp. feichtingeri, commonly known as the Feichtinger's goatsbeard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with a mat-forming habit, characterized by its soft, hairy stems and basal leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It is native to Europe and thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
